article.headline: Delaware 74, Hofstra 69
article.story: NEWARK, Del. (AP) -- Marc Egerson scored a team-high 24 points, Herb Courtney added 16 points, and Delaware defeated Hofstra 74-69 Wednesday night. Egerson grabbed 11 rebounds and had nine assists for Delaware (13-15, 9-8 CAA). Courtney had seven rebounds, and Alphonso Dawson and Brian Johnson contributed 11 points each for the blue Hens. Hofstra (11-17, 7-10), almost pulled off a comeback as the Pride rallied from 10 points down with 1:21 left before just falling short. Guard Antoine Agudio led the team with 24 points, becoming the all-time leading scorer in Hofstra history with 2,236 points, breaking the mark of 2,222 by Steve Nisenson in 1962-65. Agudio hit on eight of 24 shots from the field and eight of nine free throws to post his 16th 20-point scoring effort of the season.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
